Check to make sure we don't divide by 0

title: Check to make sure we don't divide by 0
message:
Check to make sure we don't divide by 0

In StickyGridHeadersBaseAdapterWrapper -> unFilledSpacesInHeaderGroup if mNumColumns
is equal to zero we will have a divide by 0 exception. If mNumColumns is zero we just
return 0.

title: Performance fixes. Fixes #32 and also resolves #30.
message:
Performance fixes. Fixes #32 and also resolves #30.

Don't use ReferenceViews. Id Header Fillers separate from standard
Fillers. Remove poorly functioning measurement hack to force dynamic row
height support. Change Fillers that mimic measured height of the most
recent 'real' or header item; depending on the type.

Coincidentally the changes also mean client views are no longer detached
prematurely.

title: Restore Stickied Header.
message:
Restore Stickied Header.

Accidental reformat too :(

title: Bump to API 18
message: Bump to API 18

title: Modify example for traditional row measuring.
message:
Modify example for traditional row measuring.

Depending on the scroll direction, the vanilla GridView determines its
row height from the first and the last item. This means item height must
be constant across the row.

message: Alternate method for forcing even rows.

title: Do not draw header twice when stickied.
message:
Do not draw header twice when stickied.

This is now required because the region behind the stickied header can
be unmasked revealing the double draw. Besides, drawing twice is a
waste.

title: Change to Jar Library Format.
message:
Change to Jar Library Format.

This change is to ease distribution and development using this library.
However the change requires all configuration to be programmatic, so
setting behaviour in an XML layout is no longer possible.

title: Handle vSpacing when tracking headers. Fixes #12.
message:
Handle vSpacing when tracking headers. Fixes #12.

Any positive vertical space is supported. However, only small values of
negative vertical spacing will work. The size of the value that will
work is relative to the size of the header rows and those surrounding
them.

title: Recognise when to change a sticky header.
message:
Recognise when to change a sticky header.

When a list item of another block should become the top viewable item,
the header is changed to this new item.  The code change enables the
change to be recognised, by setting a class field called header to the
new header.
